titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison -- LOUISA, a mulattrass, about 26 years old, 5 feet high, scar on left hand ; says she belongs to Mr. Legoister. BRANCH, a mulatto, about 14 years old, 4 feet 7 inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. Bibb, of Lafayette. CECILIA, a black, about 30 years old, 5 feet 2 inches high ; says she is free ; supposed to be a slave. ROBERT, a black, about 25 years old, 5 feet 5 inches high, has two fingers off left hand ; says he belongs to Mr. C. W. Sanders, one mile from Columbia, Ark. Townsernd, Perkins & Co., Pickett, Perkins & Co., of NewOrleans, Agents. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRELL, Warden. NewOrleans, Febrary 10, 1852. fe10 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. Legoister; Mr. Bibb; Mr. C. W. Sanders
Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
